bow: baby going hungry at daycare today was my first day back at work and my son second day at daycare he is 21 weeks old have tried and tried to feed him bottle of pumped breast milk but the most he has ever drank in one sitting in oz otherwise he is ebf since he would drink an ounce or two once hoped he would be ok and take bottle from the daycare providers this has not been the case day at daycare from 9:30 12 offered 3oz bottle drank oz day at daycare from 2:30 offered 3oz bottles drank oz of each total 2oz in hours have tried numerous different bottles and have not found one he seems to like yet am losing my mind with worry and guilt anyone have any advice suggestions go through similar situation have no experience with this at all my kid was formula fed and takes to any nipple we use just wanted to tell you not to feel guilty at all you re doing great sure someone will have solid advice for you but in the meantime try to relax don stress same thing happened to us she took like 3oz her first day keep trying different bottles and give her time to adjust she ll figure it out eventually my daycare offered milk in bunch of the bottles they had on hand until we found one she liked it been smooth sailing ever since this we had to try few bottles and then we switched to formula at daycare she went from ounce bm to 16 ounces of formula by week it rough transition for everyone involved your baby will adjust and things will get better promise it can be super common for ebf babies to boycott eating until they are back with mom and only eat enough to sustain until then for the first couple weeks my son was with my husband while was at work he would eat very little during the day and then gorge himself overnight and in the mornings try not to panic or feel guilty kiddo is almost certainly fine however if you think something is wrong definitely contact your ped if bottles just absolutely are working out you can also try some alternative feeding methods https kellymom com ages newborn newborn concerns alternative feeding also make sure daycare is doing paced upright bottle feeding which you can also find info about on kellymom if you have looked into it yet my friend day care had to feed the baby from behind to get her to take the bottle something about the cuddle position made her want to nurse but feeding from behind she would take bottle this is super consistent with my youngest child transition to daycare few years ago she figured it out after the first week but the guilt and anxiety just about killed me trust your son and the care providers he will be ok you will be ok if you start to notice weight loss or the caregivers become concerned then definitely contact your pediatrician my 2nd baby did this for the first few days it is ok we decided to forego doing different bottles and stuck with one nipple advent bc they had nipples we thought he would get used to the one and we knew it worked for my first and already had all the bottles he just missed me and didn have connection with the daycare workers yet it will be ok some options are to feed the baby right when you drop off and also the feed right when you pick up my last and final suggestion is for you to ask what temp they have been trying both my babies like very warm milk knew other babies that liked them cooler your daycare worker probably isn worried bc she is on the case it is ok is he eating more at night my sister went through this but she was eating lot more at night her pediatrician said it was perfectly fine for her to get the bulk of her calories at night as long as she was losing weight do feel bad mama you re doing great we had this issue big time what we ended up doing was using comotomo bottles on the fastest flow and the workers would squeeze it into her mouth but she would take the bottle for weeks most babies resolve before this once they realize the boob is not coming in my experience it not about the bottle type once she took bottle she took any bottle can ask how baby is sleeping at night mine was waking me up every hours or so to nurse so we had to cut back to one night feeding which was so hard but miraculously days later she took the bottle at school came here to say this babies can and will sometimes just not eat unless they re with mom and then they ll make up for not eating and stay latched for hours mild exaggeration but definitely know from experience so no need add extra stress same as the others don stress and offer plenty of feeding at night my daughter would skip meals all the time when was gone to work and more then make up for it at night have you tried the mam bottle my youngest would not take to the bottle and tried all different kinds the mam was the only one he would drink from until he was about months old my baby did this her first week at daycare—drank like total of 5oz one day by the second week she started taking her bottles with no problem and even holds them herself now we still breastfeed at home in the mornings and evenings but she figured out bottles at daycare you ll get through the transition mama and baby will flourish same just barely pumped enough for daycare so before we introduced solids my poor sweet girl was hangry by the time she got home she nursed the whole two hours between arriving home and going to bed felt so bad but she was allergic to every formula augh whyyyyy so there was another option have you tried using cup my daughter would never take bottle either yep we tried like bottles before finally tring mam bottles and it legit was the only one that she would take highly recommend them my first daughter was bad and wouldnt drink for my mom at work and the mam bottle was the only one she took thank god also my second daughter was ebf for months because she would not drink 1oz from anything until we found the lansinoh bottle online and thats still all she will take good luck thank you this is good idea packed an avent boon como tomo tommee tippee dr browns and mimijumi in his daycare back for tomorrow hopefully the daycare teachers will give them try am definitely going to try different bottles hopefully one will work out why did you decide to switch to formula did your baby seem to prefer formula in bottles vs breast milk not opposed to trying formula just want him to eat thank you so much honestly didn know this was common my daycare providers are acting like my son is the first baby to ever refuse bottle checked out the alternative feeding methods going to try to feed him from cup tomorrow night and maybe will order syringe on amazon if his eating doesn pick up ll call the pediatrician to get him checked out and make sure he not losing weight this may have already been mentioned but you might want to try bottle nipple with larger hole more flow my kids would stop drinking when the small nipple hole required too much effort moved to larger flow size and they got back on track have bought many different bottles but have always wondered if it just chance coincidence that baby will eventually take bottle rather than them preferring one certain kind think my little guy might be missing me my husband thinks he will eat just enough 1oz to hold off until come around took longer maternity leave with this baby he will be months old this week and cared for him 24 during my leave so know it probably hard on him ll check about the temperature of the milk hadn thought about that think he likes it boob temperature 98 thank you all— have not tried the mam bottle or lansinoh checking amazon now if you re in the us just go to any target walgreens or pharmacy and say you need medicine syringe for like baby tylenol they re free and they ll give you at least one if not handful cup feeding worked pretty well for us actually highly recommend it maybe your daycare has seen lot of it but it is super common so do stress unless baby is losing weight or if your ped is concerned they also sell mam at walmart if you want to get them asap know how stressful it can be to have baby who os refusing to eat something we noticed with my daughter was if she was being held she despised the bottle and wanted to breastfeed we had to have her sit in bouncer seat for the bottle and then she would take it just fine the daycare thought they could do better but at the end of the first day they agreed we were right and proceeded to feed her from bouncer seat might be worth shot with your son my daughter still reverse cycled some but she at least took bottles that way my husband was squeezing the bottle into the baby mouth tonight actually baby drank little less than an ounce this way so at least that something have wondered this about bottles too finally started buying different brands of bottles out of desperation felt like had to keep trying different bottles or wasn doing everything could possibly do baby is up times night to nurse how do you cut back on the night feeds ferber sleep train good idea will ask the daycare providers if they are trying different positions holds with him another mom who has been there chiming in when sent my daughter to daycare she had never taken bottle we tried for weeks beforehand and tried literally every single trick in the book was stressed and so worried she would starve when my parents watched her for days before daycare started she did not eat the entire day finally once she realized that wasn around she started taking bottle she is just stubborn and still is eventually she got used to bottles and was fine as far as what to try different nipples different bottle types different temperatures check your milk for lipase and scald it before your store it try different feeding positions etc thank you it good to know not the only one to go through this this is baby for me and feel like much better and more relaxed mom in so many ways but my baby not eating is making me feel terrible everyone thoughtful comments have helped greatly do you by chance have high lipase my second would take bottle period nursed like champ when went out of town for weekend my husband got desperate and tried sip and it tasted awful he got formula and she would take it from any freaking bottle he offered found out it was high lipase there are things you can do like scalding yeah spent think over 200 on different bottles thinking if we could just find the magic one our troubles would be over but for us that was the issue we did end up using ferber method to sleep train but she was just shy of months old when we did that and she went to daycare at around months so we did have long period of struggling and trying different things during which time was working full time and complete zombie by the time we started the sleep training had been sleeping in the nursery with her and think she was ready because we were down to one feeding after days and relatively little crying literally the next week she started taking the bottle like champion at school and two weeks after that she stopped the single feeding at night and started sleeping through for what it worth my daycare workers said it often took babies weeks to adjust to the bottle so feel like if you give it some time they might come around but think if they are getting lot of sustenance overnight they might just settle in to reverse cycling and not really care if they re able to eat during the day what flow nipples are you using we had to switch to dr brown level nipple fairly early on around months just something to consider if you re not used to using bottles with your lo amp x200b same thing here we tried tons of different bottles cup feeding syringe feeding sippy cup did not matter was so relieved once she started eating solids and then when she hit year and could drink cow milk which she freaking loves it was really difficult for anyone but me to watch baby until then but she would just nurse ton from the time got home until bed also try not to worry or feel guilty it super normal and they will eat when they are hungry enough there always an adjustment period but my baby is now super happy healthy almost year old and barely remember that time although know was super stressed in the moment you ll figure it out and baby wo starve promise try supply cup worked great for my month old nephew he wouldn take bottle at all but downs the milk no problem from hard plastic sippy cup with regular spout ve never heard of breast fed baby preferring formula from bottle but guess it possible have you tried the baby brezza bottles they are supposed to feel like breasts tried so many bottles this is the only brand my daughter would take you can get them on amazon you ve got some other good ideas in the thread but just to throw it out there when watched my best friend ebf daughter for couple of months she would drink formula with me from bottle but not breastmilk think it was the smell maybe breastmilk boobs in her mind yes she refused to take bm in bottle but took formula like champ she did not stop breastfeeding until she was 14 months old am not sure if anybody mentioned this but try mam anti colic bottles they have 94 acceptance rate and are the only ones my son drinks from do have much experience but our lactation consultant reccomeneded the breastflow bottles it double nipple and it requires the baby to suck and compress just like they have to with boob good luck just adding that my baby also refused breast milk in bottle so we combination fed when went back to work at months before totally switching to formula at months totally get how upsetting it is when you have to go back to work and they wo take bottle hang on in there my daughter had hard time too packed on average 3oz bottles of breast milk and she never finished any we tried having other people like my husband and family feed her by bottle while hide she got bit better it was funny she didn mind bottle when she was really little so we didn think it was an issue but guess she got used to just me between 3months old 6months old when we relaxed from having her drink from different situations anyways it was combo of me going back to work my boobs not producing for pumping etc that we started supplementing formula she transitioned to mostly formula by the time she was year old it was fine once got over the emotional part of it realized she is feeding better at daycare gaining weight and growing well and it was less stress on everyone he wo starve himself worse case is he ll reverse cycle and basically cluster feed through the time you have him my milk tastes like soap if it not fresh from the boob so can see that happening fix is to scald the milk he may be that particular carer first baby to refuse bottle if your son is still producing wet and soiled diapers regularly there not lot to work about babies won starve at daycare words from my ped when my son went through rough two week start at daycare thank you hurricane michael my son will not take bm cold or room temperature it got ta be warm may be the same for your son the other was getting him comfortable taking the bottle from me before anyone else it was about month long struggle of one feeding session resulting in an epic fit before he grudgingly take the bottle from me now he ll take bottle from his daycare occasionally he has his grudgingly days he just eats more when we re back together yes to this my daughter would even take bottle from me instead of nursing if faced her out on my lap looking forward whatever bottle your using you need the slowest flow newborn nipple if you are also nursing my ebf son would scream his head off at daycare at 16 weeks when they tried to give him breastmilk they suggested formula and he drank it immediately with no issue he would take bottle of breastmilk at home from my husband or the grandparents we think breastmilk made him miss us we used mam bottles they were all she would use otherwise have no advice good luck mama ok so going to disagree little with others going to comment from an infant care room worker and baby nanny perspective they need to be offering the bottle lot more and be more patient ve worked with ebf babies and some are slower eaters and you just have to keep slowly pushing the bottle would ask how long they re trying sometimes ebf babies will just take tiny bit break take tiny bit more they process takes lot longer but if you are patient the baby will get enough food omg that adorable babies drink less breastmilk then formula if your worried about underfeeding you could try formula but regular dr visits should help keep you aware of if your baby is lacking or not my baby never took bottle but he took sippy cup this is what happened to me we never got into the swing of bottles though because didn have time to scald my milk and it was just easier to put them to the breast would have been nice to have some free time in those years of breastfeeding though same if needed to totally do formula instead of spending the time to scald milk while entertaining three year old lol for sure didn even find out about scalding the milk until the second baby 🤦🏽‍♀️ thank you had no idea this was so common good idea to get syringes from the pharmacy cup feeding baby sounds super cute but little tricky going to research bit then give it try aw rough two weeks that must have felt like an eternity you re right about the diapers he is having plenty of wet diapers and about soiled dipes per day hopefully we figure this out soon so we can both have happier days and more restful nights thanks for your insights you re welcome also do be afraid feel guilty to try formula if that what works for you and baby some others have commented that babies sometimes find it easier to take that from bottle than breastmilk and that was our experience as well whatever keeps your family sane and healthy is best for baby and all of you my ebf baby takes lansinoh momma bottles excellently also took practice train yourself and inform caregivers about paced bottle feeding for ebf babies also try making the experience emotionally rewarding by looking into baby eyes and talking sweetly while he takes the bottle would actually be very concerned with daycare who has dealt with this before because it **is** that common are they brand new or something is the staff new
